results.title: The Freedom railway
results.brief_description: Looks at the Tan-Zam Railway (known locally as the Freedom Railway) which the Chinese have helped to build in Africa. 14,000 Chinese, working day and night with 40,000 Africans, have pushed this railway 1,900 kilometres from Dar es Salaam on the Indian Ocean to Kapiri Mposhi in the heart of Africa. The film conveys how the Chinese and Africans live, in their work camps, and the relationship which has developed between peoples of such different cultures.

results.title: The Frazers of Cabot Cove
results.creator_credit: Paul Fletcher, Green Park Productions, Central Office of Intormation and Humphrey Swingler
results.brief_description: Set against the background of outpost life in Newfoundland, once Britain’s oldest colony and now Canada’s tenth province, the film tells the love-story of Mary Frazer and shows the lives and problems of the simple fishing community in which she lives.

results.title: The Franck-Hertz experiment
results.creator_credit: Educational Services, Physical Sciences Study Committee and Jack Churchill
results.brief_description: A stream of electrons is accelerated through mercury vapour, and it is shown that the kinetic energy of the electrons is transferred to the mercury atoms only in discreet packets of energy. The association of the quantum of energy with a line in the spectrum of mercury is established. The experiment retraced in this film was one of the earliest indications of the existence of internal energy states within the atom.

results.title: The Fragile rice bowl: workers in New China
results.creator_credit: Richard Alexander, Brenda Louie and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
In Communist China, a worker had a guiding concept in life. It was known as the “iron rice bowl” or the notion that one would always be fed. In a brave new China, this concept has been shattered. Profiles Jessica - from her now abandoned job at the state-run factory to the new world of selling cosmetics. Shows the impact of her decision on her own life and the life of her family.

results.title: The Fox and the rooster
results.brief_description: This film is made to acquaint young children with the habits of animals and also to motivate a desire to read. A wise old owl narrates the story of how the fox tried to catch the rooster and failed. This well known episode appears in Aesop’s Fables and is dramatised by actual farm and forest animals. A skunk and a frog warn the rooster of the fox’s evil plan and the rooster climbs out of reach. An opossum tries to help the fox by knocking the rooster off his perch but both are scared away when they are told a dog is coming.

results.title: The Fox and the hound: a lesson in caution
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
This film is a promotional device for the Disney animated feature “The Fox and the hound”. It is a cautionary tale about a young fox named Tod is taken in by an old woman after his mother is killed by a hunter. Full of mischief, young Tod befriends Copper, a hound dog pup. As they grow up, however, their friendship becomes endangered by what they have become - Copper is a hunting dog, and Tod is his prey. Live action written by Philip Abbot who stars as “Uncle Phil.”
results.title_for_label: The Fox and the hound: a lesson in caution

results.title: The Fox
results.creator_credit: Raymond Stross, Claridge Pictures, Motion Pictures International and Mark Rydell
results.brief_description: Based on D.H. Lawrence’s novella of the same name, “The Fox” is a study of human relationships and just how far the boundaries can be pushed in the name of love. Lesbian couple, Jill Banford (Sandy Dennis) and Ellen March, (Anne Heywood) fondly referred to as “March” by Jill, live in a remote snowbound cabin in the Canadian countryside where they struggle to live off a farm, raising a few chickens which to their dismay, are gradually being decimated by a marauding fox. To March, the fox has become symbolic, a challenge, at a time when she is beginning to question her relationship with Jill. Her moods have become reflective, her sexual desires repressed and unfulfilled. Jill, sensing the detachment, feels confused and insecure. With the unexpected arrival of Paul Grenfel (Keir Dullea), a young, goodlooking stranger, March and Jill’s world is turned completely upside down. The attraction between Paul and March brings conflict and tension for all three leading to an eventual confrontation where choices have to be made. The story is full of innuendos, symbolism and cliches but the acting is strong and the cinematography atmospheric. Screenplay by Lewis John Carlino and Howard Koch.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raymond Stross, Claridge Pictures, Motion Pictures International and Mark Rydell

results.title: The Fourth wish
results.creator_credit: John Morris, South Australian Film Corporation and Don Chaffey
results.brief_description: A touching story about a father’s fight against all odds to attain the three wishes of his boy and of his own fourth wish. John Meillon is Casey, the father with the amazing determination to achieve the last three wishes of his dying son. You will like Casey. When the chips are down he’s got the guts to get in there and have a go. He’s taking on the world - for the sake of his son. He has to! He has three very important things to achieve and if it means bucking the system, he’ll do it to win.
